thread.title: Railroads Say Disruptions Loom if Safety-System Deadline Isn’t Extended
thread.title_full: Railroads Say Disruptions Loom if Safety-System Deadline Isn’t Extended - WSJ

author: Laura Stevens
title: Railroads Say Disruptions Loom if Safety-System Deadline Isn’t Extended
text:
Railroads are amplifying warnings that the U.S. transportation network would grind to a halt at the start of the new year if Congress makes them stick to a year-end deadline to install a new safety system.
The major freight railroads, Amtrak and other industry groups say disruption of the economy would ensue—and public health and security put at risk—if they don’t get a reprieve. Railroads last week began notifying customers that they would stop shipping certain hazardous materials as early as Dec. 1, with passenger... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In
